subject: RE: [junit] How to test continuous changing  return value?
msgSnippet: What are you trying to test? One of the teams I am working with just wrote a UUID generator. They wrote a test to run it until memory was full, failing if a
messageBody:
What are you trying to test?

One of the teams I am working with just wrote a UUID generator.
They wrote a test to run it until memory was full, failing if a
UUID was not unique.

--
Erik Meade emeade@...
Senior Consultant Object Mentor, Inc.
http://www.junit.org

> -----Original Message-----
> From: notyy [mailto:notyy@...]
> Sent: Tuesday, January 16, 2001 10:42 PM
> To: junit@egroups.com
> Subject: [junit] How to test continuous changing return value?
>
>
> hi all.I have a question in using junit ,can you help me ?
>
> say I have a class, PKGenerator,used to make primarykey for
> another entity class.see codes below:
>
> classs PKGenerator {
> public int getPK(String EntityName){
> int Result;
> / / load pk from some persistence,such as database
> Result=loadPK(EntityName);
> Result++;
> / / write it back
> savePK(Result);
> return Result;
> }
> .....................................
> }
> public class someEntity{
> String thisName;
> int PK;
> String someValue;
> public saveEntity{
> PKGenerator PKGen=new PKGenerator();
> PK=PKGen.getPK(thisName);
> save(thisName,PK,someValue);
> }
> ............................
> }
>
>
> /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
> int PKGenerator.getPK(String EntityName) method will always
> return the highest PK value from some persistence,
> so how should I write a testXXX that can always work?
>
> I searched the document but didn't get answer,any help will be
> appreciated.
>
> To unsubscribe from this group, send an email to:
> junit-unsubscribe@egroups.com
>
>
